entry.title: Families of determinantal schemes
entry.summary: Given integers a_0 \le a_1 \le ... \le a_{t+c-2} and b_1 \le ... \le b_t, we denote by W(b;a) \subset Hilb^p(\PP^{n}) the locus of good determinantal schemes X \subset \PP^{n} of codimension c defined by the maximal minors of a t x (t+c-1) homogeneous matrix with entries homogeneous polynomials of degree a_j-b_i. The goal of this short note is to extend and complete the results given by the authors in [10] and determine under weakened numerical assumptions the dimension of W(b;a), as well as whether the closure of W(b;a) is a generically smooth irreducible component of the Hilbert scheme Hilb^p(\PP^{n}).
entry.arxiv:comment: The non-emptiness of W(b;a) is restated as (2.2) in this version; the codimension c=2 case in (2.5)-(2.6) is reconsidered, and c > 2 (c > 3) is now an assumption in (2.16)-(2.17). 13 pages
